column4: Hey guys! I'm new to Linux, and am trying to run Ubuntu as a live CD/DVD first to get a feel for it, but it keeps failing to mount or something and I have no idea what I'm doing wrong.
I have an Intel 1-i7-950, 24GB of RAM, and 8 x 1TB HDD's. It should be able to run this I believe.
Lockersnatch. Nope. Under $2500
either the dvd is broken or the drive
it's a sata drive, right?
no the cd/dvd
maybe you can tell your bios to set ide compatibility for this sata port?
then without?
i don't think the cd are corrupt. it would spit out a read error
it seems linux can't access/find your dvd drive
the booting is not done by linux but by the bootloader that's why
is there a way to find out the correct way to do this for my system before I move on to a ubd drive?
I would like to exhaust all current CD/DVD drive options before jumping ship.
yes
i would poke around in dmesg| grep -i dvd  or cd and maybe do a ls /dev
busybox is quite limited unfortunately so it's a pain to work with it
never bothered to rly. understand it
...I have no idea what these commands are that you all are spitting out.
but you can look in /dev/sdX  /dev/hdX if your cdrom is there
<Random832> sam-_-: it'd be /dev/srX not sdX
you may want to read the man pages then: http://linuxmanpages.com/man8/dmesg.8.php
